comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Sir Thomas Henley was a colourful character; building contractor, politician, Mayor of Drummoyne etc. He 'fell' from a Manly ferry and drowned (14/5/35). More at adbonline.anu.edu.au/biogs/A090268b.htm Was it the custom in those days for men to take their hat off in respect? Not everyone is doing it here. Five flower cars is surely over-the-top - reminds me of a gangster funeral. The Drummoyne Chambers building and church are still there, but that wonderful 'Nestles' covered balcony with the watching lady, is not. Google street view recently:: g.co/maps/kdx59
